qas.question: Who offers the Lighting Certification Examination?

answers.text: The National Council on Qualifications for the Lighting Professions

qas.question: Which abbreviation can you append to your name after becoming Lighting Certified?
What other national examinations are available?

context: <a1_0>The National Council on Qualifications for the Lighting Professions<a1_0/> (<a0_0>NCQLP<a0_0/>) offers the Lighting Certification Examination which tests rudimentary lighting design principles. Individuals who pass this exam become ‘Lighting Certified’ and may append the abbreviation <a2_0>LC<a2_0/> to their name. This certification process is one of three national (U.S.) examinations (the others are <a3_0>CLEP and CLMC<a3_0/>) in the lighting industry and is open not only to designers, but to lighting equipment manufacturers, electric utility employees, etc.
